fuel lobbying movements trying to hinder
the efforts of the nuclear Lobby what
we've seen over the last few years is
that the nuclear industry has really
positioned itself as the good
environmental option a nuclear power
plants don't emit greenhouse gases so
they preserve our environment now that
that clean option mantra is going to be
tested because you have the groups like
the Sierra Club saying okay but in the
event of a huge disaster how bad could
it be our second question comes from the
York Times website and asks how come
nuclear energy industry advocates never
talked about the nuclear waste issue
another were a good question and one
that is not being asked much these days
for a long time the answer was thought
to be Yucca Mountain as a giant disposal
site that idea has now been effectively
killed under the Obama administration
and there's now a presidential panel
that is studying this problem but I
asked the the energy department about

I got was that it is not seen as an
urgent problem there is no danger in the
immediate future and it's more problem
years down the road so we will deal with

for
